alert.note: Alert for City of Manassas; City of Manassas Park; Culpeper; Fauquier; Prince William; Rappahannock (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 22 at 12:48PM EDT until April 22 at 1:30PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Sterling Virginia has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... East central Rappahannock County in northwestern Virginia... Fauquier County in northern Virginia... North central Culpeper County in northern Virginia... The City of Manassas Park in northern Virginia... Prince William County in northern Virginia... The City of Manassas in northern Virginia... * Until 130 PM EDT. * At 1247 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 7 miles north of Culpeper, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. * Locations impacted include... Warrenton, Linton Hall, Bull Run, Bealeton, Haymarket, The Plains, Delaplane, Hume, Manassas, Sudley, Manassas Park, Gainesville, New Baltimore, Independent Hill, Marshall, Nokesville, Opal, Remington, Catlett and Calverton. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.

area.areaDesc: City of Manassas; City of Manassas Park; Culpeper; Fauquier; Prince William; Rappahannock
